{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3497925,"name":"kuzey","username":"kuzeyatay","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/59ef9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T16:22:53.467Z","cooked":"

I was trying to create a Sys id routine for our elevator,arm and flywheels. for flywheels i think i dont have to add limits but for the arm and the elevor is there any way to add limits to the code so that it stops before the system reaches its hard stop (to avoid any mistakes). Also is SysId possible in simulation?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T16:22:53.467Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":65.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484480,"topic_slug":"sysid-limits","display_username":"kuzey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61536,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sysid-limits/484480/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3497930,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T16:25:01.252Z","cooked":"

The SysId routine is a Command, so you can add conditions that stop the command, such as if a limit switch is hit, or if the motor reports that it has reached its soft limits

button.whileTrue(
    sysIdRoutine.quasistatic(kForward)
    .until(() -> motorHasReachedForwardLimit()));

kuzeyatay:

Also is SysId possible in simulation?

Yes, but is pointless for anything other than making sure you’ve plumbed the commands properly. If you want theoretical gains, just use ReCalc.
